title: Over 2,500 Companies File for Tariff Exclusions on Chinese Imports
text:
WASHINGTON—U. S. companies are continuing to seek exemptions to tariffs on a wide assortment of Chinese imports—including frozen fish, automotive parts, cosmetics and other products—ahead of a planned increase in levies.

More than 2,500 companies had asked the Trump administration to exclude about 31,000 products as of midnight Monday, the deadline for filing requests to be exempted from the $200 billion tranche of tariffs that the U.S. implemented last year on items imported from China. Two earlier tranches covering $50 billion...
description: U.S. companies have asked for exemptions on about 31,000 products ahead of another jump in levies on wide assortment of Chinese imports Oct. 15.
